title: Weekender calendar: Oct. 9 to Oct. 11
text:
Weekender calendar: Oct. 9 to Oct. 11 
Friday 
Music 
ISU Symphony Orchestra Concert, 7:30 p.m., Martha-Ellen Tye Recital Hall, ISU Campus, $5 general, $3 ISU 
Little Big Town, 8 p.m., Stephens Auditorium, $35 to $45 
Legendary Shack Shakers/Joe Fletcher, 9 p.m., DG’s Tap House, 125 Main St., $12 advance, $15 at the door 
Theater 
Treasure Island, 7:30 p.m., Fisher Theater, $18 adults, $16 seniors, $8 ISU 
Movies 
Cyclone Cinema: Magic Mike XXL, 7 p.m., Carver Hall 101, ISU campus, Free 
Classes 
Paint Your Own Pottery: Spiral String Painting, 5 p.m., The Workspace, ISU Memorial Union, $5 general, $4 ISU 
Walk-In Craft: Rainbow Necklaces, 5 p.m., The Workspace, ISU Memorial Union, $6 
Library 
Toddler Time, 10 a.m., Storytime Room, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Family Storytime, 10:30 a.m., Storytime Room, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
La Hora del Cuento (Spanish Storytime), 4 p.m., Storytime Room, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Book Sale, 5:30 p.m., Farwell T. Brown Auditorium, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Comedy 
Scott Long, 8 p.m., The Talent Factory, 1114 Sixth St., Nevada $10 
Saturday 
Music 
Central Iowa Symphony presents Symphonies of Song, 7:30 p.m., Ames City Auditorium, $20 general, $5 age 13 through college students, free children under 12 
Hayes Carll, 9 p.m., M-Shop, ISU Memorial Union, $18 general, $12 students 
Theater 
Treasure Island, 7:30 p.m., Fisher Theater, $18 adults, $16 seniors, $8 ISU 
Movies 
Cyclone Cinema: Magic Mike XXL, 7 p.m., Carver Hall 101, ISU campus, Free 
Classes 
Yoga for EveryBODY Workshop, 8:30 a.m., Pioneer Room, ISU Memorial Union, $10 general, $8 ISU 
Meaning in Body Language Workshop: An Introduction to Delsarte Principals, 10 a.m., Pioneer Room, ISU Memorial Union, $20 general, $15 ISU 
Walk-In Craft: Rainbow Necklaces, 10 a.m., The Workspace, ISU Memorial Union, $6 
Q&A with Joe Williams, 12:30 p.m., The Workspace, ISU Memorial Union, Free 
Delsarte Workshop: Expression in Arms and Hands, 1:30 p.m., Pioneer Room, ISU Memorial Union, $20 general, $15 ISU 
Delsarte Workshop: Use Your Face!, 4 p.m., Pioneer Room, ISU Memorial Union, $10 general, $8 ISU 
Library 
Book Sale, 9 a.m., Farwell T. Brown Auditorium, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Saturday Special: Read with Me!, Storytime Room, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Crochet and Knitting Group, 11 a.m., Studio, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Teen Roleplaying Game Association, 1 p.m., PEO Room, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Miscellaneous 
Ames Area Studio Tour, 10 a.m., The Workspace, ISU Memorial Union 
Story Time with Curious George, 10:30 a.m., Iowa State University Book Store, ISU Memorial Union, Free 
Bacon Expo, 11 a.m., Hansen Agriculture Student Learning Center, $8 to $12 
Molly McDonald Poetry Book release, 7 p.m., Iowa Music Store, 300 Main Street 
Sunday 
Jenny &Tyler with Jillian Edwards, 7:30 p.m., Zeke’s 3329 Lincoln Way, $12 to $16 
Theater 
Treasure Island, 2 p.m, Fisher Theater, $18 adults, $16 seniors, $11 students 
Movies 
Monty Python and the Holy Grail, 2 p.m., Movies 12, 1317 Buckeye Ave., $6.40 
Cyclone Cinema: Magic Mike XXL, 7 p.m., Carver Hall 101, ISU campus, Free 
Classes 
Delsarte Workshop: Pin Up Poses in Motion, 9:30 a.m., Pioneer Room, ISU Memorial Union, $20 general, $15 ISU 
Desarte Workshop: Performing with Props, 1 p.m., The Workspace, ISU Memorial Union, $20 general, $15 ISU 
Walk-In Craft: Rainbow Necklaces, 1 p.m., The Workspace, ISU Memorial Union, $6 
Delsarte Workshop: Claim Your Space, 3:30 p.m, Pioneer Room, ISU Memorial Union, $20 general, $15 ISU students 
Library 
Book Sale, 1 p.m., Farwell T. Brown Auditorium, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Teen Writers’ Workshop/Play With Words, 2 p.m., Rotary Room, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Miscellaneous 
Ames Area Studio Tour, 1 p.m., The Workspace, ISU Memorial Union 
Celebrating Campus Beautiful, 2 p.m., Farm House Museum, ISU campus, Free Rules for posting comments

Comments may be monitored for inappropriate content but the newspaper is under no obligation to do so. Comment posters are solely responsible under the Communications Decency Act for comments posted on this Web site. Stephens Media LLC is not liable for messages from third parties. 
IP and email addresses of persons who post are not treated as confidential records and will be disclosed in response to valid legal process. 
Do not post: Potentially libelous statements or damaging innuendo. Obscene, explicit, or racist language. Copyrighted materials of any sort without the express permission of the copyright holder. Personal attacks, insults or threats. The use of another person's real name to disguise your identity.
